contentencoded:
European -- and some American manufacturers -- believe Chinese solar panels are being sold for less than they cost to build. The European Commission is investigating, but now Germany is distancing itself from the "dumping" allegations.

The BBC's Steve Evans joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio from Berlin to discuss.
teaser: European -- and some American manufacturers -- believe Chinese solar panels are being sold for less than they cost to build. The European Commission is investigating, but now Germany is distancing itself from the "dumping" allegations.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, May 27, 2013
description: European -- and some American manufacturers -- believe Chinese solar panels are being sold for less than they cost to build. The European Commission is investigating, but now Germany is distancing itself from the "dumping" allegations.
title: Germany backs off EU solar panel 'dumping' investigation
